needs.description: Hospitals in Khartoum are operating at less than 30% capacity due to damage and staff shortages; Al-Shaab Hospital reported 12 attacks since April 2023, leaving 450,000 people without access to surgical care.
Over 70% of water infrastructure in Khartoum destroyed; only 15% of the population has access to safe drinking water, leading to cholera outbreaks with 1,200 confirmed cases since January 2025.
Over 2.2 million people remain internally displaced in Khartoum state, with 60% living in overcrowded collective shelters lacking basic services.
IPC Phase 4 (Emergency) conditions in parts of Khartoum; 3.6 million people face severe food insecurity, with food prices up 350% since 2023.
needs.funding_gap: Food security cluster 28% funded of $396M requested

IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) conditions in North Darfur; 1.1 million people face acute food insecurity, with markets disrupted by ongoing clashes.

needs.description: South Darfur's main hospital in Nyala damaged by shelling; maternal mortality rate doubled to 850 per 100,000 live births due to lack of emergency obstetric care.
Nyala hosts over 600,000 IDPs, with 80% living in spontaneous settlements lacking adequate shelter and sanitation.
Only 25% of displaced populations in Nyala have access to latrines; open defecation affects 450,000 people, increasing disease risk.
